thread.title: Bahamas even easier to get to with expanded Delta flights
thread.title_full: Bahamas even easier to get to with expanded Delta flights

author: eTN Editor
title: Bahamas even easier to get to with expanded Delta flights
text:
Departs Georgetown (GGT) at 1:24 p.m. Arrives Atlanta (ATL) at 3:55 p.m. Frequency: Daily Effective: Dec. 19, 2015 
“The Bahamas is one of the world’s most popular destinations, and Delta is one of the world’s most popular airlines, so we are very happy that they will be expanding their service to The Bahamas. While Nassau is our capital, Exuma… known for its unique swimming pigs, Eleuthera… known for its famous Glass Window Bridge, and Abaco… a boaters’ paradise… are very popular destinations within the Islands. Of course, we are also very excited that the service to Exuma will now be operated daily, at more than double the current capacity. In a time when the airline industry is generally cutting back on frequencies and capacity, Delta’s latest announcement is proof positive that The Bahamas is and will continue to be a top destination worldwide for visitors. As we like to say, ‘It’s Better in the Bahamas!’” said Joy Jibrilu, Director General, Bahamas Ministry of Tourism. 
For inspiration and to find out more about Eleuthera, Abaco, and Exuma, and why they’re unique and exciting destinations, visit Bahamas.com today. Tickets can already be booked by visiting delta.com, Bahamas.com/delta or by contacting your trusted travel agent. 
About The Islands Of The Bahamas 
The Islands of The Bahamas have a place in the sun for everyone from Nassau and Paradise Island to Grand Bahama to The Abaco Islands, the Exuma Islands, Harbour Island, Long Island and others. Each island has its own personality and attractions for a variety of vacation styles, with some of the world’s best golf, scuba diving, fishing, sailing, and boating, as well as shopping and dining. The destination offers an easily accessible tropical getaway, and the Bahamian dollar is at par with the U.S. dollar. Do everything or do nothing, just remember It’s Better in The Bahamas. For more information on travel packages, activities and accommodations, call 1-800-Bahamas or visit their website.
